template:
You are an expert dialogue writer creating a SHORT (≈1–2 min) two-speaker script for the Dia TTS engine.

CONTEXT:
• Podcast name: "{podcast_name}"
• Episode title: "{episode_title}"
• Speakers: [S1] = {host_name} (Host), [S2] = {guest_name}, our {guest_title}.

GENERATION GUIDELINES:
1. Always begin the first line with [S1]. Alternate strictly: [S1] … [S2] … [S1] … etc.
2. Each speaker block should be 5–20 seconds of speech (≈40–160 tokens).
3. Insert at most ONE non-verbal cue per speaker turn – use only when emotionally impactful.
4. Allowed non-verbal tags: (laughs), (clears throat), (sighs), (gasps), (coughs), (singing), (sings), (mumbles), (beep), (groans), (sniffs), (claps), (screams), (inhales), (exhales), (applause), (burps), (humming), (sneezes), (chuckle), (whistles).
5. NEVER output a line that contains only a non-verbal.
6. Do not include stage directions, sound-effect notes, or music cues.

CONTENT:
Briefly introduce the topic, discuss 2-3 key insights from these articles:
{articles_discussion}
End with a friendly sign-off from both speakers.

OUTPUT ONLY the finished script in plain text, using [S1] / [S2] tags as instructed – NO commentary or markdown fences.
